content.raw:
There is a decision tree, [`map_supervisionLabel_seg_alwaysTrue`](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/src/5c89e4f789fd6d648cbd7cbe11b5b512788cda6c/segway/data/map_supervisionLabel_seg_alwaysTrue_semisupervised.dt.txt?at=default) that is invoked by the [`supervisionLabel_seg_alwaysTrue`](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/src/5c89e4f789fd6d648cbd7cbe11b5b512788cda6c/segway/data/input.master.tmpl?at=default#input.master.tmpl-48) `DeterministicCPT` to connect the `alwaysTrue` and `supervisionLabel` random variables. See [`supervision.tmpl`](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/src/5c89e4f789fd6d648cbd7cbe11b5b512788cda6c/segway/data/supervision.tmpl?at=default) to see GMTKL structure of these variables.

The basics of the decision tree syntax are described well in the old GMTK manual. I think the operators are not. But the basic decision tree allows ranges which should make it not too difficult to do what you want to do.
content.html:
There is a decision tree, map_supervisionLabel_seg_alwaysTrue that is invoked by the supervisionLabel_seg_alwaysTrue DeterministicCPT to connect the alwaysTrue and supervisionLabel random variables. See supervision.tmpl to see GMTKL structure of these variables.

The basics of the decision tree syntax are described well in the old GMTK manual. I think the operators are not. But the basic decision tree allows ranges which should make it not too difficult to do what you want to do.
